comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Are you sure Gay Byrne is not in the car?  Lovely photograph, pity they did away with the trams, can you imagine the tourist attraction they would be today?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Never mind the tourists, it'd be great for Dubliners! Love the Luas, but it just doesn't have the same glamour as these beasts...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 54160790@N07
comment._content: My father still gives out about them getting rid of this!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54160790@N07] In the Irish Independent from 1 June 1959, it was reported that there were posters on front and back of the very last tram, saying: "Farewell dear friends, this is the end: we've travelled miles and miles; for eight and fifty years we shared your laughter, tears and smiles. 'Tho some may say we're worn out, expensive or too slow, we brought you safely up and down in sunshine rain or snow."
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 76240074@N04
comment._content:
Thank you so much for this! I have hazy memories of being a 4 year-old on the tram that day with my father and grandfather.

Do you have any other pictures from the day?

Thanks,
Brian.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/76240074@N04] That's brilliant! Do you recognise yourself, or your father and grandfather in this one?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 76240074@N04
comment._content:
Another great picture, but I'm fairly sure there's no me! (My father was a six footer which was tall for the time so he'd have stood out in the queue and we definitely traveled on top.)

"Teach a man to fish" - I'll be using the NLI Catalogue search.

Many Thanks,
Brian.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 46650209@N07
comment._content: Closing down tram or trolleybus systems is always a foolish thing to do: you might economise at the beginning, but maintaining a fleet of diesel buses is just as expensive, if not more, on the long run.

comment.author: 8420103@N05
comment._content: When I lived in The Gem in Howth, the trams used to go up behind the house. At that stage I wanted to be either a Tram Driver or a Bishop. Didn't make either.

comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content: Great picture.  The streetcar, the Swift, and to top it off, a vintage bicycle.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/howard33] Thanks! If it's vintage bicyles you're interested in...
